sentences.sContent: Judging by her past performance, Jane should do very well.
sentences.sCn: 从以往的表现来看，简应该会干得很好。

sentences.sContent: From past experience she knew that it was no use arguing with him.
sentences.sCn: 根据过去的经验，她知道和他争论是没有用的。

sentences.sContent: Study some past exam papers to get an idea of the questions.
sentences.sCn: 仔细看看以前的一些考卷，了解一下考题。

sentences.sContent: ...Some people are absorbed in the past but not open to new memories...
...And such research might even suggest ways for us all to relive our past with greater clarity...
...Most people do not have clear memories of past events...
...Viewing the past in high definition can make it very difficult to get over pain and regret...
...letting go of the safety and security of the past gives us great fear...
...but for the past few years scientists have wondered if the big cats were hanging on in remote parts of Sudan and Ethiopia...
...I think it has been even more fun keeping the secret for me the past few weeks...

phrases.pCn: ◎照老皇历办事，按旧章程办事；因循守旧
过去（的经历）；[医]既往病史，过去病史
n. 老手；对某种技艺有丰富经验者

trans.tranOther: done, used, or experienced before now
used to say that an unpleasant experience has ended and can be forgotten
